resources.string:
Scan the area for potential hazards before proceeding.

 Is there danger present?

(e.g. fire, live wires, chemical spill)

If the casualty appears unconscious, do they respond when you: 

 1. Loudly say their name?
 2. Shake them firmly by their shoulders?
 3. Roll your knuckles on their sternum?

1. Place one hand on the casualty's forehead
 2. Gently tilt their head back
 3. Pull their chin down using two fingers and thoroughly inspect their throat
 (use torch if needed)

 Are their airways clear?

1. Observe chest
 Is it moving up and down?
 2. Feel lower chest
 Is it expanding?
 3. Listen, by placing your ear near their mouth and nose
 Can you hear anything?

 Are they breathing regularly, or at all?

string.name: compressions_body
string.b:
1. Lay them flat on their back
 2. Place heel of one hand in the centre of their chest and your other hand on top
 3. Push down firmly so chest depresses 1/3 in depth. Repeat 30 times using Play button as guide. 
 4. Tilt their head back and pinch their nostrils closed
 5. Place your open mouth firmly over theirs and blow twice
 6. Repeat 1-5 until they respond or help arrives

resources.string: Please enter a brief description of the problem (one or two words) to receive further instructions
WARNING: by not calling emergency services immediately, you are endangering the life of the casualty and may be responsible for their death
If foreign material present, place casualty in recovery position and clear airway with fingers
